Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service from all the Staff”
Reviews.Author: HAWK-TheTraveller
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend at this hotel and it was a most pleasant stay. It started with the front desk person who was was very attentive to detail and made us feel special. Later in the evening when we returned to the hotel we were offered free cookies to take to our room. The next morning we had a good breakfast (included) and when things ran out the staff were quick to replenish the dishes. Our room was spacious and very clean. OUr room rate was also very attractive. All-in-all we were very pleased with our stay because of staff who cared for us.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: hcdy
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel if you want to avoid the high price of parking in the city. Parking is free and the complimentary breakfast is a plus. The hotel was renovating their rooms when we were there and we stayed in one of the renovated rooms so it was nice and clean. There is a microwave and refrigerator in the room which is very handy.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as the poor reviews suggest”
Reviews.Author: HolidayForUs
Reviews.Content: We had a large room with two queen beds that was clean, comfortable and quiet even though the hotel is on a main road. Other rooms nearer the highway may have been noisier. There was free wi-fi in the room and we had a warning message from our internet browser, but we used it and did not have any problems. There was a buffet breakfast and we found plenty to eat – cereal, bananas, muffins, cinnamon rolls, bacon, and the pancake making machine was particularly good! We stayed for two nights in the Holiday Inn Express & Suites during October 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Boy, is this placed TIRED.”
Reviews.Author: WhatHome
Reviews.Content: I know it's an HI Express, but come ON.... This place is still stuck in the khaki-trench-coat and hair mousse of the 90s. It's a bid tired-looking, could possibly use a refresh. Gripes: feels like it's in a crummy area on the north side of Seattle (oh wait, it is). Curved shower rod = good; shower curtain not long enough to fully close = bad. Elevators? They're not feeding the hamsters to run fast enough - elevators take a while. Nightdesk doesn't like to brew fresh coffee, as I apparently found my iced Poor Man's Mocha after the first sip. And into the trash can it went. Par: Beds are decent, guest laundry machines work well (they even gave me a Complimentary dryer sheet, thank you very much..). Bathroom hardware did its job, minus the ridiculous shower curtain. Hot breakfast is standard HIE stuff, didn't disappoint. Wireless internet appears to be working well, so no disturbing of my pet peeve there. This is a satisfactory place for business travel; but we're on vacay, so it's kind of a bummer. Would I/we stay here again? If there wasn't anything cooler available, ok.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced & Dirty!!!”
Reviews.Author: Firemedic3674
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly and breakfast was good. HOWEVER, the bathtub had hairs from previous occupant, the toilet was a mess, the bath towels were not clean at all (one still wet from previous guest) and inside the ice holder was a gross unknown substance. Hotel manager was apologetic and let us leave with a refund.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Sallieb3
Reviews.Content: Great value, nice property, new carpet, granite and tile bath, big room, great customer service, great breakfast, free parkng

Reviews.Title: “Not typical Holiday Inn experience - very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: mmadole
Reviews.Content: We booked this room for our family vacation 3 months in advance and requested a non-smoking room, with two queen sized beds. We received the two queens but the "non-smoking room" given to us was on the 4th floor...the smoking floor. As soon as we opened the door, the room stank of smoke. We didn't even unpack, and went straight to the front desk, where they informed us that indeed our room was a non-smoking room, but it was on a smoking floor?!?! On top of that the garbage cans had chewed gum in them, there was no fridge in the room, and the pool had sand at the bottom of it. Front desk's solution to the smoky room was to open a window and run the bathroom fan, or they could give us some air freshners. We booked 3 months in advance specifically to ensure a non-smoking room, and it seems that the staff could care less. Not very professional at all. Thankfully this is not my first Holiday Inn experience so I know this is not typical of their other locations, however I won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for family get-together”
Reviews.Author: trvl2liv
Reviews.Content: We celebrated my mother's 80th birthday in Seattle, with out-of-town and out-of-state relatives all converging here. This location was convenient to Northgate, where we were having family portraits taken, and the Woodland Park Zoo, which we planned to visit (but didn't because of the weather). There are actually 2 Holiday Inns on Aurora Ave., so some of the other reviews I've read are meant for the other one, as this is not close to the Space Needle or downtown like the other hotel. The front staff was very nice and helpful, the rooms were clean and beds were great, plus we made use of the sitting room area with a small couch, chairs, and table, and sink and mini-fridge. We were offered the use of the breakast area off the hotel lobby for our birthday gathering of 13, but ended up in one of the rooms to have birthday cake, and that worked out fine for our group of ages 1-1/2 to 87. The 12-yr. olds loved the small pool. My husband and I used the fitness center, which overlooked the pool area. The fitness center is very small and the equipment old and very noisy, but it worked. There is nothing to clean the equipment surfaces between users (like the standard squeeze bottle and paper towels in most gyms now). The equipment should be updated. We appreciated the included breakfast, which was fairly standard, and checkout was a breeze with our bill slipped under our door the morning we left. The free parking was fine, and it was easy to get to the freeway (I-5). We had some reservation issues prior to arriving (not the hotel's fault) but were helped with sorting it out by the General Manager, Mr. Oh. Thank you very much! My only complaint is that this not an entirely non-smoking hotel, and we had booked non-smoking rooms, but you have to walk through the smoking rooms hallway to get to the non-smoking rooms. This seems backward to me. So we did notice a little smoky smell getting off the elevator, but there was none in our non-smoking hallway or rooms. The rooms also have a window you can open a little for fresh air.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Tommy72A
Reviews.Content: Visiting Seattle Woodland Zoo with the family, decided to use this as a home base for the 2 night stay. After reading some bad reviews, we were ready for the worse case scenario but I was pleasantly surprised. Hotel staff was very friendly and was greeted with a welcome gift (something to do with the priority member perk?). It is an older building but it's kept clean and I didn't see any sings of neglect. My son really enjoy the pool and plenty of restaurant choices in the area. Keep in mind, this is not down town Seattle. It's 15-25 min drive to downtown. This is not a touristy part of Seattle but if value is your priority, you'll like it. One complaint, their breakfast can step up a notch.

Reviews.Title: “Averageland.”
Reviews.Author: cobsbread
Reviews.Content: My room was fine, I used Priceline, got a first floor room. Everything was fine, but the bathroom had little ants in it. At one point there were about 10 in the sink, sometimes there would be a couple on the floor... didn't see any anywhere else in the room, just the bathroom, all three days. Slept in each day so didn't get to try the complimentary breakfast. :( Its about a 10 minute drive to downtown Seattle. Worked fine for me. Oh, they have one computer available for use, in the lobby, which is pretty meh, and it was giving me warnings when I used it, which doesn't seem right either. The girl at the desk was super nice though. :)

Reviews.Title: “Common but convinent”
Reviews.Author: joe60429
Reviews.Content: Near Space Needle and seattle downtown The server was very kindly Breakfast was so good

Reviews.Title: “New scams to watch out for....”
Reviews.Author: MikeWatabLake
Reviews.Content: Got a Hotwire room for 3 nights. When we got to the room it had been stripped of regular amenities and they had been replaced with a mattress and box spring that was of the cheapest ad lowest quality. We travel a lot and had never run into this 2 class of rooms. The scary part is the internet connection. Both Chrome & Firefox gave us huge, never before seen, warnings about the connection. The certificate is totally bogus and could allow data mining to occur! We contacted Hotwire and got refunded for additional night and got the hell away from this place. This is owned by a franchisee and they have "known" about the "problem" with the internet connection for "a long time" but have no plans to fix it. They may be selling your personal information!

Reviews.Title: “24 Hour Pool Makes Up For Being Understaffed”
Reviews.Author: cow_manx
Reviews.Content: We checked in after dinner and shopping (around 9:30pm) so it was a little on the late side and the lobby was empty. We had to wait quite a while for service as the desk had been abandoned. Once the clerk returned, carrying a plunger, the check in process was fine but I can't help but be left with the impression that this location, either due to recession or it being January, had to make staffing cuts - the front desk clerk doubling as plumber does not inspire confidence. But from that point on everything was great; the 24-hour indoor pool is fantastic, the room was nice and spacious, shower water pressure was great, free wired high-speed internet was easy, and check-out was a prompt breeze. The TV was an old CRT but had some good channel selection, the vending machine options were limited (only beverages) and you have to ask for the free water at the desk but on the whole it was a great stay - the potential for problems never materialized. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is ok, staff don't go above and beyond though...”
Reviews.Author: icemaiden013
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel earlier than anticipated and had hoped for an early check in (we'd stayed in a holiday inn express in Bellingham the night before and they'd let us check in early). We pulled in to the parking lot and there was about 3 cars parked. Hubby went in and asked if we could check in early and he said 'No'. Ok, so, either they had a hotel full of dirty rooms, a hotel full of people who walked and didn't have cars in the lot, or, he just wasn't being accommodating. When we did check in, there was probably about 5 or 6 cars in the parking lot, we asked for a King room but apparently they didn't have one of those, we got a Queen room with no fridge (which we'd also had in the previous HIE). Room was clean etc but just not thrilled about the 'lesser' service we got here compared to a hotel in the same chain a little further north. The hot tub and pool are both great and the breakfast is excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: discanaries
Reviews.Content: We arrived late on the 18th of January. Went to our room and as I walked in I could smell cigarette smoke. I called down stairs and told them that I had ordered a non-smoking room. They told me that this was a non-smoking room. When I told them I could smell cigarette smoke they told me to come to the desk and they would give me a different room. To my surprise they gave us an extended stay room. As soon as we went into the room I could smell a nice clean room. We went downstairs and told them that the room was great and Thank You for the change in room. We stayed for 5 days and had the best service you can have. The breakfast had a lot to choose from, they thought of everything, even a very healthy choice. Free coffee all day long and bottled water. Great recommendations for places to eat, tried them and found they were great, no complaints. So if you need a place to stay just out of the City you must stay here. We would stay here every time we come to Seattle. Thanks Again To A Great Staff!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and handy for the Needle”
Reviews.Author: HonestEnglishman71
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel we stayed in on a five week trip to the States and we booked it because we know what we're going to get with the HI Express. Very spacious room, clean and comfortable, the bed as always was a delight, could sleep for weeks in them! Unbeknown to us, there were several music concerts in Seattle over this weekend, and the hotel was virtually full, although you wouldnt really know it as it was so quiet. We only really knew at breakfast when the area was full but it was still easy to get your food and find a table. Breakfast, again, as usual at the Express hotels brilliant, think I'm the biggest fan of their bacon, can't ever get enough on my plate!! Overall a great hotel, about a 5 minute walk to the Space Needle area, secure underground parking and I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Took good care of us”
Reviews.Author: mtnxplor
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn was exceptionally clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I didn't see the strip club as noted by another reviewer. Easy drive to downtown. The breakfast bar was standard, however, the food was fresh and there was a nice variety. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with great location but staff didn't know what a family-friendly restaurant was!”
Reviews.Author: suesloswing
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Express hotel located near the Space Needle. It was clean and the breakfasts were good BUT the maids were VERY SLOW or non-existent some days AND the desk staff were not good with suggesting dinner spots that had food for kids OR that were casual enough to take a family with a 7 year old and a 12 year old!

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: ChardynChat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days. There is nothing special about the place. The rooms were ok. We booked through a travel agent and when we arrived were told that because agents got a special rate they didn't have to provide the room type we requested - the only guarantee was a room, no more. We were given a smoking room (despite having booked months in advance). The staff were disinterested, at best and down right rude at worst. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone...

Reviews.Title: “Look on the outside was deceiving!”
Reviews.Author: SimpleTraveller_10
Reviews.Content: It would appear that the hotel was renovated on the ouside to make it look attactive. The inside looks tired and dated. My particular room looked like there had been issues with the ceiling so there were streaks of paint all over. Wallpaper was separated at the seams. Desk legs wobbley and had to straighten on arrival. No hot water for shower at 9:00 am. Breakfast was not readily available. Most items were empty, and the bacon and cinnamon rolls on hand was cold. When I enquired about local transit options on two occasions, staff were uninformed and suggested I look online. I wouldn't use this Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Good Location”
Reviews.Author: MercurySandton
Reviews.Content: Clean and well worth the stay walking distance to the Needle

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel,but with some disappointment.”
Reviews.Author: hotelrvwr
Reviews.Content: My opinion of the hotel was just okay. The breakfast bar was okay. Not much variety. the bed was comfortable. The so called cable/satellite tv was a joke! Not very good selection of tv channels at all! The shower was okay. But then i am very picky when it comes to showers. So i have yet to find a shower in a hotel room that meets my expectations. I am not sure if i would stay there again. It could use some improvements.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near Seattle”
Reviews.Author: toptendog
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the familiarity of the brand and because there is no charge for parking; the downside of that is that you have to drive to explore Seattle, but it's only about 15 min. It is on Aurora Ave., so if you drive another 5 min. you reach the Pike st. Market, the peers etc. The only reason this is not a real 4* hotel (but it is for us!) is that it doesn't a real closet, a safety deposit box and a true 'hot' breakfast. Oh, and the location... Otherwise, we had a great, big, clean room, two queen beds and a spotless washroom (c/w all the toileteries) with a tub. A coffee maker. A writing desk with an 'executive' chair. The mattresses were very comfortable and the A/C efficient and not noisy. The front office people were polite. We plan to return again when we visit Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “ok on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Dexius
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel at a cheap rate. Next to a strip club if you are into that.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Clean, and Convenient.”
Reviews.Author: msmomSeattle
Reviews.Content: I live 20 blocks south of this Holiday Inn and pass it all the time. We are having some repair work done to our house and needed to stay somewhere close for two nights. I had it narrowed down to the Holiday Inn Express, Hotel Nexus, or Comfort Inn. This one was a hands down winner for the following reasons: 1. Very clean grounds, lobby, room, and bathroom. 2. Included breakfast. 3. Free Wi-Fi. 4. Has a pool/hot tub (comments about this later) 5. Great rates with Entertainment Card. 6. King Suite has a mini fridge and microwave. This is one of the nicer budget places I've stayed in for a long time. Pick up a Seattle Entertainment book online if you're planning on being in Seattle for a few days or more. I believe the current edition has a coupon for Kidd Valley burgers a half block north of here. You can walk there and eat dinner there and save a bit of money.

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you don't need to be in City Center”
Reviews.Author: drswift
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised when I got to my room. It was a large room with all the amenities, and very clean. It had both firm and soft pillows (nice size ones), sitting area with couch and table, as well as microwave and coffeemaker. Wi-fi was wireless or Ethernet. Facilities include a nice workout room, indoor pool and jacuzzi. The breakfast buffet was outstanding; it had a full range of hot dishes (bacon, sausage, egg, gravy and biscuits) as well as a good vairety of cereals, rolls, juices. I had a great rate from Priceline, but the distance from downtown was not accurate. The hotel was about 20 north of City Center on 99.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Nice”
Reviews.Author: SunnyinAK
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel in North Seattle for just one night, we didn't have reservations. We stopped by and they were happy to accomodate us and gave us a terrific rate for the night. The hotel room was clean and comfortable. The front desk service was very good and there was good parking.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed expectations”
Reviews.Author: rocheharborhome
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at this hotel while visiting Seattle for some shopping and sightseeing. The location is great for driving to Seattle (and zoo), Northgate and Alderwood malls, but not a great location for walking anywhere. But this wasn't a problem for us. All of the hotel employees we encountered we extremely helpful and pleasant. The pool was great for the kids to burn off some energy, and the breakfast had something for all of us. Evening cookies were a treat. The entire hotel, from the rooms to the pool to the breakfast area, seemed very clean and well maintained. The room was particularly nicely cleaned and stocked. My kids loved going next door to the Kidd Valley restaurant for burgers and shakes. As far as road noise, we left the fan on for "white noise" and didn't notice any traffic noise at all.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms at Holiday Inn Express”
Reviews.Author: Traveler-Kaye
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in October and were mostly pleased with the hotel. The room we chose was a king suite with couch area, mini-fridge and microwave. I liked that they had a bag of microwave popcorn in the room for you. However, they don't have mugs in the room for coffee (only styrofoam cups). I had to heat my water for tea in the coffee maker since I wasn't sure about microwaving the styrofoam. The bathroom is nice with one of those shower curtains that bows out away from the shower to provide a little more space. The towels were nice and fluffy and there were plenty of them. The bed was comfortable and we slept very well. The heater in the room worked wonderfully and was unexpectedly quiet for a hotel unit. We stayed in a non-smoking room on the 2nd floor and didn't have any problems with smoke or noise from other guests. We ate the hot breakfast at the hotel every morning. There were cheese omelettes, bacon, sausage, cinnamon rolls, hard-boiled eggs, instant oatmeal, yogurt, fresh fruit, juices, coffee, tea and hot chocolate. It wasn't too fancy, but decent for an included breakfast. The breakfast room is fairly large and we didn't have a problem finding a table each morning. This hotel does include parking, but it is not near most of the sights in Seattle. We chose the hotel for other reasons. This part of town is okay, but not an area I would go walking in around at night. Staying closer to downtown would probably be more expensive, though. Overall, the hotel offered a good "Holiday Inn Express" experience and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: jcdjcdcVancouver
Reviews.Content: Our party of six was looking for a hotel that offered a great overnight stay at a reasonable rate. Our suite accommodated a party of six adults. In the morning we were delighted to have a complimentary hot & cold breakfast. The breakfast area was large, clean and was not overcrowded at any given time. The front desk was helpful in giving us directions to Pike's Market and also arranged shuttle surface to our cruise ship at a reasonable price. The downside and upside to the hotel is its location. Close to downtown and the most popular attractions in Seattle. Aurora Street is a busy, noisy street throughout the day and night. Would I recommend this hotel - absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and Comfy... Loved the Coffee!”
Reviews.Author: HairChic
Reviews.Content: We went to visit my sister who resides in Seattle and had just gotten remarried. We are from another resort area, Myrtle Beach, and so are very familiar with a little traffic like you might experience with this hotel location so it was not a problem for us. We LOVED this hotel! The front desk staff was very helpful and friendly. It is very clean... even the hallways ALWAYS smelled so fresh and pleasant! The beds were very comfortable, too. There are fresh baked cookies and WONDERFUL coffee in the lobby nightly... we enjoyed these often after a long day in the city! The breakfast room was filled with so much to choose from! Scrambled and boiled eggs, bacon, sausage, biscuits, cereal, oatmeal, cinnamon rolls, orange juice, milk... you name it... they probably have it! The pool is small, but the kids didn't mind! I do wish they would put up some sort of noise absorbing materials to lower the decibels a little... it got extremely loud in this room at times. The Northgate Mall was very easy to find from this location. A big plus for us shopaholics! I would like to recommend to this hotel that they find a way to have guests use the parking lot more appropriately... the lot can handle the vehicles for the tenants if there were not so many of them double parked. This caused a problem on our last night there... my sister was going to park and come up to say goodbye, but had to just drop us off instead due to having absolutely nowhere to park her very small Subaru sedan.

Reviews.Title: “Cigarette smoke everywhere”
Reviews.Author: canadatrav
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as it was reasonably priced, and the hotel we were staying at was booked. We stay exclusively in Holiday Inn hotels, so we figured this would be ok, despite the reports of the location on Trip Advisor. Even though this hotel is a little north of a very commercial part of Seattle, we really didn't have any problems with the location, as most of our site seeing was away from this area. This appeared to be a newer hotel, but had the oldest beds out of any HI Express we have ever stayed in. They were so worn out you could hear the springs every time you moved. The biggest disappointment for us was that this hotel is not smoke free. If we would have known this we most likely would not have booked there. Even though we were in the room farthest from the smoking wing we could still smell smoke in our room (as I'm sure any non-smoker could) which was quite unpleasant. Not to mention we weren't thrilled about having our children exposed to the smoke. We have nothing against smokers, but the hotel would probably be better off to have complete floors smoking or non-smoking, so the smell doesn't travel down the hallway. Two other minor inconveniences were the fact that there is only one washer and dryer for laundry and no business office (just a computer by the front desk). They do have a good size dining room for breakfast in the morning which was nice. Overall, it wasn't the worst hotel we've stayed in but we most likely would never stay here again due to the cigarette smoke and uncomfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Decent rooms in questionable n'hood, but terrible front desk clerks”
Reviews.Author: Steel33
Reviews.Content: The Hotel by itself was not bad, though located in a questionable neighborhood, but the front desk staff is just terrible. Here's the sequence of events - I register at the front desk and then go up to our room only to find that our keys don't work. So I walk down and the clerk reissues another, without even an apology. I go back up again and find out the Fridge/MW we asked for was not available in our room. I go back down, again, and the clerk (with an unforgettable name of 'Junior' and a very unprofessional attitude) says that only the King suites had them, despite what the Hotel website says. It's almost as if you are in a East European Student Hostel and not a 'business-traveler' hotel as Holiday Inn Corp positions ts 'Express' brand as. I then ask for a King suite since we were promised a Fridge/MW, but he says that they don't have any available. I insisted that with a child traveling with us, that was an absolute necessity, and after about 10 minutes of back and forth, surprise, surprise he miraculously finds one! He then asks me if the earlier room was clean and if we had used it (we didn't even have time to unpack!!) and then asks that I return the keys to the earlier room immediately, which involved another trip up and down to get my wife's key. I almost decided to quit at that point. Anyway we were tired from a long flight and decided to stay. So after a total of 3 trips back and forth from our room, we finally settle down. The stay in the room was pleasant enough, though by the second night one of our keys stopped working. I decided not to bother asking for a replacement again. I work as a Marketing Manager for a large Travel distribution corporation, and plan to follow up with Holiday Inn corporate with my issues regarding unprofessional staff at hotels carrying their brand.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: monarat
Reviews.Content: This Inn was located in the Northgate area, not too far from the Northgate Mall. Busy street but very quiet in the hotel. I heard some rain during the night, but unless there was a siren, no street noise. Room was a suite, very clean and had a microwave, small refrigerator, countertop with bar sink. Bed was SO comfortable. Breakfast was the usual hard boiled eggs, cereal, bagels, toast, danish and yogurt. Large dining room with big screen TV. The staff kept up the dining area and was very helpful at check in. I liked that there was no charge to park there, yet a few blocks away was I-5 and you could be in downtown Seattle in 10 minutes (in non-rush hour times). Also close to the zoo. Not really an area where you can walk to dinner. Recommend driving toward Northgate Mall as there were plenty of places to eat on streets around the Mall. We did not go in the Mall, so maybe more there as well.

Reviews.Title: “Not Convenient”
Reviews.Author: DR_SEA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the borderline of a not so good neighborhood and is a little far out of town to be called Seattle. Only a two lane road gets you into downtown, much rush hour traffic. Rooms okay, clean.

Reviews.Title: “North (!!) of Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Travelinbob19
Reviews.Content: Seattle currently is going through a major road Construction project. I-5 through Seattle has lane closures all day long. If you are planning an activity near the airport, Safeco Field, or in the city, be advised you will most likely be sitting in traffic coming from or going to the hotel. That being said, once here the place is great. 4 stories of comfort. Breakfast area I thought was a little small but the 2 women working it were constantly refilling all of the empty bowls and pitchers. Room was very comfortable and clean. However, I did not explore the local area during my visit which I think was a good idea. I get the feeling that this hotel is not in the best of neighborhoods. If headed to Seahawks Training Camp in Kirkland, to Everett, or Vancouver, this would be the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Sagebrush
Reviews.Content: Good value for a travelling family. We booked a "King efficiency suite" which had a king sized bed, sofa bed as well as a fridge, sink and microwave with cupboards. The pool facilities were clean as was the room. The service was good and the parking and internet were included. A bit of a drive to downtown, but worth it considering the much lower room price.

Reviews.Title: “Neat Freaks Welcome Here!”
Reviews.Author: Zingera
Reviews.Content: I am a neat freak mom travelling with a high maintenance family. This hotel was perfect in every way. Clean, comfortable, economical, breakfast was great, pool clean, laundry convenient, no extra charge to park, service friendly and excellent. There was absolutely nothing to complain about. It exceeded my expectations. Location great. Rooms well appointed. I will go there again and again. Our room was facing the north back so it was totally quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kikatika
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express Hotel and Suites on July/07 , the front desk staff was really friendly and helpful with directions, restaurants, etc. The location is great, we were able to walk to the Space Needle, and many atractions. Breakfast was what you can expect, cereal, toast, hard boiled eggs, etc. The down side was that the room was kind of small, and the house keeping came to clean really late, by then we had come back to our room to take a break, so we did not had our room done for 3 days. The swimming pool room was very hot, and the pool was small. But over all, I would recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CB1978
Reviews.Content: Okay, it's the Holiday Inn Express, so you know what you're getting. It's not the ritz, but its really comfortable, and the location is great. It's in a perfectly safe area. Not slap bang in the middle of the city but walking distance from everything. (And really really close to the space needle). It also has the advantage of being right beside the Holidy Inn, which has a bar in it - there wasn't much in the way of bars nearby so that was handy. I think the Holiday Inn might also have a restaurant too but I can't remember. We paid for a basic room but got upgraded to a suite, so we had our own little kitchen with a fridge, kettle, microwave etc - which was very handy. There is no restaurant or room service in the hotel, but they have a menu for surrounding takeaways who will deliver to your room, so that was great. We got lovely pizzas from a near-by takeaway. I HAVE to coment on the breakfast bar!!! I don't usually eat breakfast at all, but I was at that breakfast bar every morning without fail. They have loads of stuff and you just go up and help yourself (so if you have a big appetite you do very well out of it cos you can take as much as you want!). You can toast your own bagels, make your own waffels, there's fruit, cereal, yoghurts, muffins, juice, eggs.....pretty much anything you could possible want. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Seattle
HotelInfo.Address: 14115 Aurora Ave. N, Seattle, WA 98133
